issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: We probably need to maintain Python 3.5 on Linux and macOS for the time being, but we may want to drop it for Windows since conda-forge isn't supporting Python 3.5 anymore, so maintaining wheels for Python 3.5 will come with extra cost

comments.body:
I'm not sure it's worth maintaining for macOS either. macOS users typically install they own Python because the system-provided one isn't adequate.

Even on Linux I'm not sure there's much of a benefit IMHO...
Since we have everything working for 0.14.0, let's not rock the boat for now, and clean things up after the release

I changed the issue scope to drop Python 3.5 altogether. NumPy is about to drop 3.5 so we should too

https://numpy.org/neps/nep-0029-deprecation_policy.html
I don't see Python 3.5 in any CI entry, so I think we've dropped it unknowingly? :-)
Do we want to drop this for 0.16.0?

Crossbow still has wheel tasks for Python 3.5, but Antoine is right, I don't see it in GitHub Actions for the other test jobs.

I don't understand your question [~wesm]: do you mean to do this ticket and drop support for 3.5 in 0.16.0, or drop this ticket from the 0.16 scope (and produce wheels for py 3.5 for this release)?

Sorry for being unclear, I was suggesting to stop producing the wheels now. Since people are still installing 3.5 and it's not actively causing us a problem, I think we can keep shipping the wheels in 0.16.0. We may need to drop them soon after though
Hi, it looks like the Windows 35 wheel file is already not included into the 0.16.0 release, was this planned?

To cross-link this with the ML discussion 

https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/re8a9f4d2a3878754076f90be48172d06e8df16c0d7ea796d0eba6d31%40%3Cdev.arrow.apache.org%3E

We dropped the Windows 3.5 wheel due to a dependency conflict that started happening during in https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5569. We figured if someone needs the Py3.5/Windows combination that they would be motivated enough to help fix the problem we ran into. The wheels have been prone to maintenance issues as the work is essentially unfunded, despite the wheels being heavily depended on by well-heeled corporations
It seems like there's no urgency on this

I'll note that Numpy does not support 3.5 anymore:
https://numpy.org/neps/nep-0029-deprecation_policy.html

cc [~uwe]
I'd support dropping Python 3.5 after 2.0.0 since there are some critical 1.x.x issues fixed (e.g. ARROW-9924)

Well, here we are: some dependency of pytest is broken on Python 3.5:
https://github.com/apache/arrow/runs/1458449054?check_suite_focus=true
